name: Data Observation Toolkit
description: DOT is a toolkit that can be used to monitor data as it's collected and enters a database to flag problems with data integrity, data quality, protocols, outliers and other scenarios that might need attention

sdgs.relevance: In 2019, the United Nations Statistical Commission stated: “Every misclassified or unrecorded death is a lost opportunity to ensure other mothers and babies do not die in the same way. When it comes to health, better data can be a matter of life and death.”  DataKind developed the Data Observation Toolkit (DOT) in response to a gap in digital health solutions space to monitor health data generated by other digital tools for problems with data integrity, quality and other scenarios that might need attention. The toolkit aims to provide easier access to data monitoring without the need for deep technical skills.

NonPII.nonPIIAccessMechanism: All data is in the DOT DB, so there are many ways to import/export. The demo is populated in this way. Additionally, appsmith uses an API

openStandards: Internationalization (i18n)- All Input/output is managed by the Python standard library

dataPrivacySecurity.collectsPII: PII data is NOT collected NOT stored and NOT distributed.

userContent.contentManagement: Content is NOT collected NOT stored and NOT distributed.

protectionFromHarassment.harassmentPolicy: The target audience for this community is skilled users of the DHIS2 software (expected age 20+), and discussion is limited to topics relating to software development as indicated on the issue tracker - https://github.com/datakind/Data-Observation-Toolkit/issues Code of conduct - https://github.com/datakind/Data-Observation-Toolkit/blob/main/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md

privacy.privacyCompliance: DataKind is GDPR compliant and measures in place to support GDPR compliance. Adherence left to implementers.  https://www.datakind.org/privacy
